# fetchRequest

**Instance Property**

The fetch request used to do the fetching.

## Declaration

```swift
var fetchRequest: NSFetchRequest<ResultType> { get }
```

## Discussion

If you want to modify the fetch request, you must follow the steps described in [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSFetchedResultsController#Modifying-the-fetch-request].

## Related Documentation

- **init(fetchRequest:managedObjectContext:sectionNameKeyPath:cacheName:)**: Returns a fetch request controller initialized using the given arguments.

## Getting Configuration Information

- **managedObjectContext**: The managed object context used to fetch objects.
- **sectionNameKeyPath**: The key path of the attribute that determines which section the fetched entity belongs to.
- **cacheName**: The name of the file used to cache section information.
- **delegate**: The object that is notified when the fetched results changed.
- **deleteCache(withName:)**: Deletes the cached section information with the given name.
